title: 1990년 Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe of Indians v. United States Department of the Navy James Webb, as Secretary of the Navy 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe of Indians v. United States Department of the Navy James Webb, as Secretary of the Navy. 판결일: 1990-03-19. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE OF INDIANS, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF the NAVY; James Webb, as Secretary of the Navy, Defendants-Appellees
**판결일**: 1990-03-19
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Canby, O'Scannlain, Tang

## 변호인

Robert C. Pelcyger, Fredericks & Peley-ger, Boulder, Colo., for plaintiff-appellant., Donald A. Carr, Acting Asst. Atty. Gen., Fred R. Disheroon, Robert L. Klarquist, and Elizabeth Ann Peterson, Attys., U.S. Dept, of Justice, Land & Natural Resources Div., Washington, D.C., for defendants-appellees.

## 인용

- 898 F.2d 1410

## 판결문 요약

898 F.2d 1410
    20 Envtl. L. Rep. 20,572
    PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE OF INDIANS, Plaintiff-Appellant,v.UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF The NAVY;  James Webb, asSecretary of the Navy, Defendants-Appellees.
    No. 88-1650.
    United States Court of Appeals,Ninth Circuit.
    Argued and Submitted June 6, 1989.Decided March 19, 1990.
    
      Robert C. Pelcyger, Fredericks & Pelcyger, Boulder, Colo., for plaintiff-appellant.
      Donald A. Carr, Acting Asst. Atty. Gen., Fred R. Disheroon, Robert L. Klarquist, and Elizabeth Ann Peterson, Attys., U.S. Dept. of Justice, Land & Natural Resources Div., Washington, D.C., for defendants-appellees.
      Appeal from the United States District Court for the District of Nevada.
      Before TANG, CANBY and O'SCANNLAIN, Circuit Judges.
      O'SCANNLAIN, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      We must determine whether certain practices of the Department of the Navy in leasing acreage and contiguous water rights to local farmers in Nevada violate federal law.  The Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe of Indians alleges that these practices seriously threaten the continued viability of an endangered species of fish, the cui-ui, in violation of the Endangered Species Act.  The Tribe also alleges that the Navy's practices violate the National Environmental Policy Act as well as the Navy's fiduciary obligations to the Tribe.
    
    
      2
      * The Department of the Navy (the "Navy") owns and operates Fallon Naval Air Station ("Fallon") ...
